qoute: Doubt can only be removed by action.
I never could tell a lie that anybody would doubt, nor a truth that anybody would believe.
A fanatic is a man who consciously over compensates a secret doubt.
All pain is either severe or slight, if slight, it is easily endured; if severe, it will without doubt be brief.
An accurate observer is, no doubt, rare; but an accurate thinker is far rarer.
Any truth is better than indefinite doubt.
As to the adjective, when in doubt strike it out.
Authority has every reason to fear the skeptic, for authority can rarely survive in the face of doubt.
Beauty is one of the rare things that do not lead to doubt of God.
Believe those who are seeking the truth; doubt those who find it.
Doubt can only be removed by action.
I never could tell a lie that anybody would doubt, nor a truth that anybody would believe.
A fanatic is a man who consciously over compensates a secret doubt.
All pain is either severe or slight, if slight, it is easily endured; if severe, it will without doubt be brief.
An accurate observer is, no doubt, rare; but an accurate thinker is far rarer.
Any truth is better than indefinite doubt.
As to the adjective, when in doubt strike it out.
Authority has every reason to fear the skeptic, for authority can rarely survive in the face of doubt.
Beauty is one of the rare things that do not lead to doubt of God.
Believe those who are seeking the truth; doubt those who find it.
Believe those who are seeking truth, doubt those who find it.
Better to remain silent and be thought a fool, than to speak and remove all doubt.
Buddhism is not a creed, it is a doubt.
Defined in psychological terms, a fanatic is a man who consciously over-compensates a secret doubt.
Doubt and despair, like hope, are born in imagination.
Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
Doubt is Devil-born.
Doubt is part of all religion. All the religious thinkers were doubters.
Doubt is the father of invention.
Doubt is the incentive to truth and inquiry leads the way.
Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
Doubt thou, the stars are fire;
Doubt whom you will, but never yourself.
Doubt, of whatever kind, can be ended by action alone.
Faith is a wonderful thing, but doubt gets you an education.
Faith keeps many doubts in her pay. If I could not doubt, I should not believe.
Faith lives in honest doubt.
Faith means belief in something concerning which doubt is theoretically possible.
For right is right, since God is God and right the day must win. To doubt would be disloyalty, to falter would be sin.
Four be the things I'd better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt.
Giving is not at all interesting; but receiving is, there is no doubt about it, delightful.
Good morning, Pooh Bear, said Eeyore gloomily. If it is a good morning, he said. Which I doubt, said he.
How prone to doubt, how cautious are the wise!
However, I don't doubt that a wave of immigration will come to Poland.
Human beings are perhaps never more frightening than when they are convinced beyond doubt that they are right.
I doubt whether classical education ever has been or can be successfully carried out without corporal punishment.
I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.
I respect faith, but doubt is what gets you an education.
I show you doubt, to prove that faith exists.
I wouldn't put it past God to arrange a virgin birth if He wanted, but I very much doubt if He would.
I'm sure Obama is an atheist; I'm sure Kennedy was an atheist, but I doubt if Pope Frank is.
If I am anything, which I highly doubt, I have made myself so by hard work.
If the Sun and Moon should ever doubt, they'd immediately go out.
In a few years, no doubt, marriage licences will be sold like dog licences, good for 12 months.
In case of doubt, do a little more than you have to.
It is best to love wisely, no doubt, but to love foolishly is better than not to be able to love at all.
It is best to love wisely, no doubt: but to love foolishly is better than not to be able to love at all.
It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.
It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.
It is better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to open one's mouth and remove all doubt.
Just think of the tragedy of teaching children not to doubt.
Knowledge is gained by learning; trust by doubt; skill by practice; love by love.
Life is doubt, and faith without doubt is nothing but death.
Live so that you can at least get the benefit of the doubt.
Love and doubt have never been on speaking terms.
Men become civilized, not in proportion to their willingness to believe, but in proportion to their readiness to doubt.
Modest doubt is called the beacon of the wise.
No doubt exists that all women are crazy; it's only a question of degree.
No doubt Jack the Ripper excused himself on the grounds that it was human nature.
No doubt the artist is the child of his time; but woe to him if he is also its disciple, or even its favorite.
Of all the inventions of man I doubt whether any was more easily accomplished than that of a Heaven.
Our doubt is our passion, and our passion is our task.
Philosophy goes no further than probabilities, and in every assertion keeps a doubt in reserve.
Philosophy is doubt.
Philosophy when superficially studied, excites doubt, when thoroughly explored, it dispels it.
Servile doubt argues an impotence of mind, that says we fear because we dare not meet misfortunes.
The dead should be judged like criminals, impartially, but they should be allowed the benefit of the doubt.
The greater the knowledge, the greater the doubt.
The ideal, without doubt, varies, but its enemies, alas, are always the same.
The road to perseverance lies by doubt.
The trouble with the world is that the stupid are cocksure and the intelligent full of doubt.
There is no doubt that life is given us, not to be enjoyed, but to be overcome -to be got over.
There is no doubt: the study of man is just beginning, at the same time that his end is in sight.
There is something pagan in me that I cannot shake off. In short, I deny nothing, but doubt everything.
There lives more faith in honest doubt, Believe me, than in half the creeds.
There must be a real and living doubt, and without this all discussion is idle.
There's naught, no doubt, so much the spirit calms as rum and true religion.
To doubt is worse than to have lost; And to despair is but to antedate those miseries that must fall on us.
To give a reason for anything is to breed a doubt of it.
To walk through the ruined cities of Germany is to feel an actual doubt about the continuity of civilization.
Today the theory of evolution is about as much open to doubt as the theory that the earth goes round the sun.
Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!
We know accurately only when we know little, with knowledge doubt increases.
We think our fathers fools, so wise we grow. Our wiser sons, no doubt will think us so.
When in doubt, mumble; when in trouble, delegate; when in charge, ponder.
When in doubt, suggest that a subcommittee be appointed.
When you doubt, abstain.
While the mind is in doubt it is driven this way and that by a slight impulse.
Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is - it is her shadow.
Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt there truth is - 'tis her shadow.
Who shall decide when doctors disagree, And soundest casuists doubt, like you and me?
Wise men, when in doubt whether to speak or to keep quiet, give themselves the benefit of the doubt, and remain silent.
Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
Doubt is not a pleasant mental state, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
No doubt concentration camps were a means, a menace used to keep order.
No fine work can be done without concentration and self-sacrifice and toil and doubt.
